pull.title: ci: Use travis_fold on Travis CI only

verification.payload:
tree c0c2ae4c92fc70c4dc06af4ac4c52694a1fa7ae4
parent 79a3b59cc70622fbadc43ade5fce31fcf94d852d
author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1604952746 +0200
committer Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1604952746 +0200

ci: Use travis_fold on Travis CI only

events.message: ci: Use travis_fold on Travis CI only

events.body: review ACK dde5f4a1a57a6fcbbadb47e35b2b409eadac0a2f, but I am not sure if it is worth it to keep travis related code in our ci files at all, given that we move away from it.
I agree with Marco, lets just finish up removing the remaining Travis related code. I assume that'll be done as part of, or just after #20467.
#20467 is only about the linters. `./ci/test` doesn't use travis anymore already.
Agree. After linter moving from Travis, all Travis related code should be just removed.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -6,15 +6,20 @@
 
 export LC_ALL=C.UTF-8
 
+FOLD_COMMAND=""
+if [[ ${TRAVIS} == "true" ]]; then
+  FOLD_COMMAND="travis_fold:"
+fi
+
 BEGIN_FOLD () {
   echo ""
   CURRENT_FOLD_NAME=$1
-  echo "travis_fold:start:${CURRENT_FOLD_NAME}"
+  echo "${FOLD_COMMAND}start:${CURRENT_FOLD_NAME}"
 }
 
 END_FOLD () {
   RET=$?
-  echo "travis_fold:end:${CURRENT_FOLD_NAME}"
+  echo "${FOLD_COMMAND}end:${CURRENT_FOLD_NAME}"
   if [ $RET != 0 ]; then
     echo "${CURRENT_FOLD_NAME} failed with status code ${RET}"
comments.body: Pretty sure this is dead code due to use of our `errexit`.
Not sure if it is worth it to keep travis related code in our ci files, given that we move away from it.
